We can keep guns out of the hands of people who shouldn't have them.

I won't rest until we do. And I know that incredible partners around the country like @MomsDemand & @Everytown won't either. 

We do this for love. https://t.co/Nnu2jWNesq
But our work can't stop there. We have to invest in our communities. We have to invest in violence intervention programs. We have to treat gun violence as what it is - a public health emergency.

Whether it's banning assault weapons, implementing red flag laws, closing the Charleston loophole, implementing comprehensive background checks, or going after ghost gun manufacturers - we need those solutions and more.
The solutions we're talking about at the federal level to #EndGunViolence are incredibly important - critical - to stopping the violence we've seen unfold throughout our country.

The residual trauma for our young people after experiencing gun violence is also immense. That's why we need to invest in mental health services for our young people - especially in the wake of COVID-19. 
https://t.co/7yOVzeyi8C

It's why I was proud to work with him on introducing the Break the Cycle of Violence Act, which invests in CVI's and other important community initiatives.
https://t.co/XwKkbM7C8v

That's why initiatives like Community Violence Intervention (CVI's) programs are so critically important. It puts trusted partners in the community to help prevent violence before it starts. 

Trusted partners like Darryl "Wolfie" Chambers.

There have been 1,257 victims of gun violence in our state since 2017. 

Each of those over 1,200 victims has their own story. Their own trauma. Their own challenges. Their own families. And their own lives - often changed forever by the violence they've experienced.

Just last year, there were 23 victims of gun violence in our state, including a 15-year-old girl who was left in critical condition. 

These are our children. https://t.co/pyN6WZGglA

For 5 years, the folks at @delawareonline have been tracking gun violence in our state. 

Reporters like @brittanyhorn have been relentlessly telling these stories.

The names, numbers, and ages are staggering and should give every Delawarean pause.
